nl.inl.blacklab.index

Class Indexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.Indexer

  • public class Indexer
extends java.lang.Object
    Tool for indexing. Reports its progress to an IndexListener.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean continueAfterInputError
      If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), should we try to continue indexing, or abort?
      protected boolean createAndIndexStartReported
      Have we reported our creation and the start of indexing to the listener yet?
      protected java.lang.Class<? extends DocIndexer> docIndexerClass
      The class to instantiate for indexing documents.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> indexerParam
      Parameters we should pass to our DocIndexers upon instantiation.
      protected IndexListener listener
      Where to report indexing progress.
      protected static org.apache.log4j.Logger logger 
      protected int maxDocs
      Stop after indexing this number of docs. -1 if we shouldn't stop.
      protected boolean processArchivesAsDirectories
      When we encounter a zip or tgz file, do we descend into it like it was a directory?
      protected boolean recurseSubdirs
      Recursively index files inside a directory?
      protected Searcher searcher
      Our index

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        protected static final org.apache.log4j.Logger logger

      • searcher

        protected Searcher searcher
        Our index

      • maxDocs

        protected int maxDocs
        Stop after indexing this number of docs. -1 if we shouldn't stop.

      • listener

        protected IndexListener listener
        Where to report indexing progress.

      • createAndIndexStartReported

        protected boolean createAndIndexStartReported
        Have we reported our creation and the start of indexing to the listener yet?

      • processArchivesAsDirectories

        protected boolean processArchivesAsDirectories
        When we encounter a zip or tgz file, do we descend into it like it was a directory?

      • recurseSubdirs

        protected boolean recurseSubdirs
        Recursively index files inside a directory? (or archive file, if processArchivesAsDirectories == true)

      • docIndexerClass

        protected java.lang.Class<? extends DocIndexer> docIndexerClass
        The class to instantiate for indexing documents. This class must be able to deal with the file format of the input files.

      • continueAfterInputError

        protected boolean continueAfterInputError
        If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), should we try to continue indexing, or abort?

      • indexerParam

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> indexerParam
        Parameters we should pass to our DocIndexers upon instantiation.

public Indexer(java.io.File directory,
                  boolean create,
                  java.lang.Class<? extends DocIndexer> docIndexerClass,
                  java.lang.String contentsFieldName)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. use version without contents field name
        Construct Indexer
        Parameters:
        directory - the main BlackLab index directory
        create - if true, creates a new index; otherwise, appends to existing index
        docIndexerClass - how to index the files
        contentsFieldName - name of the main contents field
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • setContinueAfterInputError

        public void setContinueAfterInputError(boolean b)
        If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), should we try to continue indexing, or abort?
        Parameters:
        b - if true, continue; if false, abort

      • setCollator

        @Deprecated
public static void setCollator(java.text.Collator collator)
        Deprecated. use Searcher.setDefaultCollator()
        Set the collator to use for sorting (passed to ForwardIndex to keep a sorted list of terms). Defaults to English collator.
        Parameters:
        collator - the collator

      • setProcessZipFilesAsDirectories

        @Deprecated
public void setProcessZipFilesAsDirectories(boolean b)
        Deprecated. renamed to setProcessArchivesAsDirectories()
        When we encounter a zipfile, do we descend into it like it was a directory?
        Parameters:
        b - if true, treats zipfiles like a directory and processes all the files inside

      • setProcessArchivesAsDirectories

        public void setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean b)
        When we encounter a zip or tgz file, do we descend into it like it was a directory? Note that for accessing large ZIP files, you need Java 7 which supports the ZIP64 format, otherwise you'll get the "invalid CEN header (bad signature)" error.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, treats zipfiles like a directory and processes all the files inside

      • setRecurseSubdirs

        public void setRecurseSubdirs(boolean recurseSubdirs)
        Should we recursively index files in subdirectories (and archives files, if that setting is on)?
        Parameters:
        recurseSubdirs - true if we should recurse into subdirs

      • setListener

        public void setListener(IndexListener listener)
        Set the listener object that receives messages about indexing progress.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener object to report to

      • getListener

        public IndexListener getListener()
        Get our index listener, or create a console reporting listener if none was set yet. Also reports the creation of the Indexer and start of indexing, if it hadn't been reported already.
        Returns:
        the listener

                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokens)
        Add a list of tokens to a forward index.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - what forward index to add this to
        tokens - the tokens to add
        Returns:
        the id assigned to the content

      • addToForwardIndex

        public int addToForwardIndex(java.lang.String fieldName,
                    ComplexFieldProperty prop)
        Add a list of tokens to a forward index
        Parameters:
        fieldName - what forward index to add this to
        prop - the property to get values and position increments from
        Returns:
        the id assigned to the content

      • addToForwardIndex

        public int addToForwardIndex(java.lang.String fieldName,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokens,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> posIncr)
        Add a list of tokens to a forward index
        Parameters:
        fieldName - what forward index to add this to
        tokens - the tokens to add
        posIncr - position increment associated with each token
        Returns:
        the id assigned to the content

      • index

        public void index(java.lang.String documentName,
         java.io.Reader reader)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Index a document from a Reader, using the specified type of DocIndexer
        Parameters:
        documentName - some (preferably unique) name for this document (for example, the file name or path)
        reader - where to index from
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • index

        public void index(java.io.File file)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Index the file or directory specified. By default, indexes only .xml files in a directory. Recurses into subdirs only if that setting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        file - the input file or directory
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • index

        @Deprecated
public void index(java.io.File fileToIndex,
                    boolean recurseSubdirs)
           throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                  java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. recurseSubdirs is now a setting instead of a parameter (defaults to true)
        Index the file or directory specified. By default, indexes only .xml files in a directory.
        Parameters:
        fileToIndex - the input file or directory
        recurseSubdirs - recursively index subdirectories? (overrides the setting)
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • index

        public void index(java.io.File fileToIndex,
         java.lang.String glob)
           throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                  java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.Exception
        Index a group of files in a directory or archive. Recurses into subdirs only if that setting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        fileToIndex - directory or archive to index
        glob - what files to index
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.Exception
        java.io.IOException

                    java.lang.String glob,

                  java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. recurseSubdirs is now a setting instead of a parameter (defaults to true)
        Index a group of files in a directory or archive.
        Parameters:
        fileToIndex - directory or archive to index
        glob - what files to index
        recurseSubdirs - whether or not to index subdirectories (overrides the setting)
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.Exception
        java.io.IOException

      • indexFileList

        @Deprecated
public void indexFileList(java.io.File listFile)
                   throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. not really used, implement your own if required
        Index a list of files. If the list contains a directory, the whole directory is indexed, including subdirs.
        Parameters:
        listFile - list of files to index (assumed to reside in or under basedir)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • indexFileList

        @Deprecated
public void indexFileList(java.io.File listFile,
                            java.io.File inputDir)
                   throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. not really used, implement your own if required
        Index a list of files. If the list contains a directory, the whole directory is indexed, including subdirs.
        Parameters:
        listFile - list of files to index (assumed to reside in or under basedir)
        inputDir - basedir for the files to index, or null if the list file contains absolute paths
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
